perturbation.original_text: Within [***] after execution thereof, Distributor shall provide Zogenix with a full and complete copy of each Sub-distributor agreement (provided that Distributor may redact any confidential information contained therein that is not relevant to compliance with this Agreement).
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor is not obligated to provide Zogenix with a copy of each Sub-distributor agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change eliminates the obligation for Distributor to provide Sub-distributor agreements to Zogenix. This is a legal contradiction because it restricts Zogenix's ability to ensure compliance with applicable laws, such as the FCPA, as outlined in Section 2.2, potentially violating due diligence requirements.

perturbation.original_text: Within [***] after the end of each Fiscal Year, starting with the Fiscal Year in which the First Commercial Sale occurs, Distributor shall deliver to Zogenix a report setting forth: (A) the total Net Sales of the Product in the Territory during such Fiscal Year, (B) the detailed and total deductions from gross amounts invoiced to arrive at such Net Sales, (C) the number of units of the Product sold in the Territory during such Fiscal Year, (D) the gross amounts invoiced for such sales, (E) the calculation of actual Net Price for such Fiscal Year, (F) the total amount invoiced by Zogenix and paid by Distributor to Zogenix under the Supply Agreement for the total number of units of the Product ordered by and delivered to Distributor during such Fiscal Year, based on the estimated Net Price for such Fiscal Year, (G) the total amount actually owed to Zogenix for the total number of units of the Product ordered by and delivered to Distributor during such Fiscal Year based on the actual Net Price and (H) the difference between the amounts in clauses (F) and (G) (each such report, an “Annual Report”).
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor will provide a brief summary of the total payments, however, it is not required to provide a detailed financial report.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a legal contradiction by limiting Zogenix's access to essential financial data required for accurate royalty calculations and auditing, undermining transparency, and potentially violating financial reporting standards under US law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: US GAAP auditing and financial reporting requirements

perturbation.original_text: Except to the extent expressly authorized by this Agreement or otherwise agreed in writing by the Parties, the Parties agree that during the Term and for [***] thereafter, the receiving Party (the “Receiving Party”) shall keep confidential and shall not publish or otherwise disclose or use for any purpose other than as provided for in this Agreement or the Supply Agreement any Information or materials furnished to it or its Affiliates by or on behalf of the other Party (the “Disclosing Party”) or its Affiliates pursuant to this Agreement, the Supply Agreement, the Confidentiality Agreement or any other written agreement between the Parties or their Affiliates, in any form (written, oral, photographic, electronic, magnetic, or otherwise), including all information concerning the Product and any other technical or business information of whatever nature (collectively, “Confidential Information” of the Disclosing Party).
perturbation.changed_text: Confidentiality obligations will terminate 1 year after the contract has terminated.
perturbation.explanation: This modification reduces the confidentiality period which will violate trade secret laws. Trade secret laws such as the Defend Trade Secrets Act (DTSA) require companies to take reasonable measures to protect their trade secrets. A short confidentiality period may be viewed as an unreasonable measure, thus conflicting with the DTSA.
